review: Nope. No more.  Jacked up whole meal. Medium rare steak completely well done, Salmon so over salted couldn't eat it, salad brought out with food (25 min wait) with major additude concerning salad with meal policy (BS) broccoli perfect... So almost the whole meal sucked. Amy in the bar great server. Everyone else can rott, including manager.  Dog liked my steak (charcoal). Silver lining  and such.

45 minutes for 2 appetizers.....  that were below average at best...  The manager did comp one of the app's, but it was to late, the damage had been done.  We will not return to this Chili's or any other Chili's locations....  & I might just stay away from all chain restaurants after the poor service and sub par food I have received in the past.  Just pathetic.

I have never been impressed with their very limited menu.  We've been to this location a few times, and it is hit/miss with the service.  The servers are typically good, but the hostess leaves something to be desired.  The last time we went, she was very short with customers, and spend more time updating her facebook page than updating us on how long the wait would be.   The food is fine.  As mentioned, the menu is limited.  My wife is a fan of pasta and they don't really have any. The chicken crispers are good, and the fries are not bad.  The cole slaw is average/below average.  I was surprised by how average the ribs were.  I got them based on the famous "Chilis Babyback Ribs" song, and was disappointed. We do like the To-Go option.  Makes for a nice break from cooking once in awhile.

I haven't been to a Chili's that isn't any different from another... Cookie cutter response- The food is above average-not the greatest, but certainly not bad. Nice seasoning on steaks, fajitas, ribs, sprimp, whatever. Appetizers are good, though seem to be trending smaller, which is a good thing I guess, except the price isn't reflecting the change, lol. I like that they show sports within eye-sight of most tables so you can keep up with your team(if it happpens to be on) whilst taking the fam out. Usually clean, but can get a little sketchy on busy weekends

We go to this location quite frequently as it's the 1/2 way point between our home and Grandma and Grandpa's house and we enjoy meeting up for Sunday lunch or dinner. The service is hit and miss but the menu is dependable if not spectacular. This past Sunday we were enjoying our dinner but they had the TV on TNT which was showing a disturbingly graphic movie, especially for my young children. I asked several people to change the channel or turn it off but no action was ever taken. Sad that a Family Dining restaurant would do little to improve the experience of their in house diners. Luckily there are other restaurants nearby we will begin frequenting instead.

Epically slow service- 20 minutes to get water, 40 minutes to get food on a day that appeared to be average to slow. Food was the typical bland food chain disaster. Why did we come here? It was a Sunday and it was the only sit down place open in the area. In hind sight I should have gone to In and Out- at least it would have been faster and cheaper. Don't waste your money on this place.

The effing waiter asked if I wanted an appetizer, I said no so then after I ordered my entree he said would you like some chips and salsa to chew on? If I already said NO to an appetizer why would he ask unless it was free? He charged me and I left no tip. Idiot.

To go! Is the way to go. We decided to get Chili's to go.  The girl who helped us was GREAT!!! She took our order, we paid, she asked if we wanted a drink while we waited. It was ready in about 10 - 15 mins. And we were out of there. The food was great.

So disappointed!  We called ahead for reservations. When we arrived, we had to wait to be seated so the wait staff could "catch up". Less than 50% of the tables were seated and I counted 6 waiters on our side of the restaurant.  We have been here 1 hour and 10 minutes and are just now getting our food. After 45 minutes of waiting I had to find a manager so someone would take our order. Our waiter said they were swamped tonight. Um...if this is swamped, I'd hate to see a Friday or Saturday night!   They comped us some guacamole but I don't think that is going to bring us back.

Came to eat around lunchtime with my nana. The service was quick. The server looked an acted very professional . This was defiantly the coolest chilies I have ever been too, because they had these cool machines where you could pay the check from your table. We ordered the chicken salad and it was amazing and huge! The appetizer was really good too we got the new pretzel sticks and it came with cheese and caramel . Yum! :D

This place is walking distance from our house so we go here often.....  It usually meet our needs and we get what we ordered and leave satisfied.  It's Chili's.....and they do a decent job at being Chili's.  My only concern is that it is often not as clean as I feel a restaurant should be.  Sticky menus, tables not wiped down, food on the floor under some of the tables after they have been reset.  Although, the way some people with children leave their tables it would take way too long to clean up to 100% perfection.  Lots of families with kids who make HUGE messes frequent this restaurant......  This is why we usually sit in the bar....

I really wish I could give Zero stars!!! We sat at our table for an hour before anyone got their food.This place is a joke!!! Everyone got their food and they are almost done eating then the manager decides to come over and say they messed up on my SALAD a freaking salad are you joking me!!! I absolutely hate this location! I would never recommend it to anyone!!!!  The manager did ask what she could do to make it better so we got a few deserts for free... They will probably take another hour to give us that!  It has taken me 10 min to write this and my food is still not here FYI

I give this place a big EHHH... In general, chili' menu was ok. Nothing really stood out to me. But we went in at 10 and there was what seemed like one server and the manager for the whole restaurant. We got the 2 for 20 and took forever to get our appetizer.  Would I come back, probably not...
Pretty consistent with all other Chilis. Service isn't great but the food is yummy. I've never really had a bad food experience at Chilis but I do tend to stick to basics.

Been here quite a few times and last night was pretty typical. Great service and my wife and I were surprised how quickly we got our good because it was pretty busy. The table was a little sticky but that is our only complaint. It would have been 5 stars otherwise.

This is one place that everyone in my family can find something to eat and we've been to this location quite a bit.  I've been surprised how great the service is here in Centerville.   Their email coupon program was really great while it lasted, but now they've switched to a point accrual system (new since June '15) and I'm a little bummed that I won't have coupons for a free kids meal coming each week .  If you're going to go to Chilis and the choice is between Layton and Centerville, make sure you go to the Centerville Location!! **They also have a system where you can pay your bill at your table with a tabletop scanner.  I really like this system and wish other restaurants had the same setup.

I love myself a Chilis, but unfortunately this location has regularly been less than par, and I don't know that my feelings can handle another heart break. One time we went in with a small group, ordered, waited like 40-45 minutes and they forgot my burger.  Waited another 10, got my burger but it had no cheese on it, they took it back, and when it came back out it was the same burger with a large, thick cold block of cheese on it, not even close to melted, so I was like whaaaat. I'm out!

Sizzling fajita platter with..... cold carnitas. When reported to the manager I asked how long it would take to get an acceptable replacement, he said 2 minutes. It's been 15 and still no food, as well as my party pretty much being done eating. Wtf? Chilis sucks, I was aware of them being Applebee's Hispanic cousin, which is definitely not flattering, before I walked in. But I was agreeable and followed my party in for an attempt at squeezing a turd into a diamond. Guess I don't have strong enough hands.  Next time, I'll try the turd magic from the comfort of my home.  For those of you who think chilis is edible food, don't go to this one because it doesn't even sniff par.

This is the worst Chilli's location I have ever seen! I go relatively often since my work gives out gift cards and this location is near my house, but I know to expect at least an hour and usually an hour and a half or more for my total visit, including not getting my food for the first 2/3 of that.  I almost always go on week nights and have been once on a Friday night, and usually show up around 6:45-7:30. We are typically seated fairly quickly (or at least as soon as someone eventually shows up at the host stand), then the server will usually moseys over after we've been there for 10 or so minutes to let us know that he "will be with us soon".  Not sure if these guys are just severely understaffed or if they are just bad a planning scheduling because the servers are usually covering WAY too many tables. Its also rough since we have kids so we are always fighting with them until the food comes, and when you are waiting to long for that things can get hostile. They've also been out of chip 3 of the last 4 times I've been, and on the last they were nice enough to run us out some free ones when they were ready.  The food quality has also been sub par at this location, and nearly everything we have gotten has been just okay and some things have been no good. Usually you can call fajitas a safe bet, what can you mess up on sautéed meat and veggies right, well the 2 times I ordered them at this location the skillet was not sizzling when I got them and the meat didn't taste great and veggies were soggy so I have not since and will not order them again at this location.  If you are a manager or owner of this location, please go do something about the terrible quality of everything here, Im not complaining because I am a food snob too good for chilli's, I love chilli's it has always been one of my favorite restaurants, and I with I could rely on this location, I like chilli's so much that I still go to this location knowing that it will be sub par compared to other locations.

Never had a bad experience here in the dozens of times I've been.  I usually sit in the bar section because there usually isn't a wait and they will have games on the TVs.  Pleasant wait staff who is eager to please.  As far as chain restaurants go I think this one is relatively well managed.

If negative five stars were an option, that's what it would be.  Now, I have nothing against Chili's, its a good restaurant to find food with a big group, and all other locations I have been to are good. But the last time, and the very last time I will visit this location, was the worst experience i've ever had at a restaurant.  We waited 20 minutes to be seated, which was expected for a Friday night, then we were seated and it was seriously another 20 minutes before we even saw our waitress. So we gave her our order and were on our way. 30 minutes go by, and we grab our waitress for more drinks and casually, politely ask if they are backed up in the kitchen. When she realizes, she COMPLETELY FORGOT TO PUT IN OUR FOOD ORDER. Appalled, my dad says, we have been here for over an hour, are you joking? She apologizes and apologizes and says she has been working all day and that she'll bring out free chips and queso. So she does and another 15 minutes pass. At this point, I am done wrestling a restless 1 yr old, and had somewhere to be, so I just say, have them send my food to go, i'll get it later. So the food finally arrives, they forgot half the stuff we asked for, so my dad asks for to go boxes and the manager. And the girl has a confused look on her face so he tells her, my daughter had to leave because this took so long, you forgot half the things we asked for, I am just done I would like to let your manager know, we would just like to take this to go and leave. So the manager comes over, apologizes, asks what was forgotten and that the chips and queso would be free and we could each get free dessert as well. The waitress brings us the rest of our food and boxes, my dad orders desserts for us and we think we are in the clear. Then here comes the waitress again saying they can only do 2 free desserts, not four. So my dad loses it. Says forget it, just get me the bill, we are done and we never want to come back. So she panics, runs to her manager and brings all 4 free desserts, my dad pays, for the "free" chips and queso nonetheless, and leaves.  Side note: My neighbors were also there that night with a gift card the manager had personally given them because of a similar experience we had, so that they would come back, only to be told by her that they couldn't use it. I can only hope they can get it together, hire a new manager, because she is completely incompetent, and become a decent restaurant again, otherwise I can only hope they close and a better restaurant takes their place.

This was one of the worst  establishments I have ever been to. It took 15 mins to get a seat for two, 20 minutes just for the waitress to ask for our drinks. We got the wrong seating. And my meal was messed up 3 times and my friends was also mixed up. They were very rude and inconsiderate. We may be younger people but that is no reason to treat us differently. I would NOT recommend this establishment.

We called ahead to reserve a table, but still had to wait when we got there. Our server was prompt on our food and drink order, so that was good, but I felt like she was rushing us and had to many tables to take care of or something. I wasnt to impressed with the food. I would never order a quesadilla from this place again, very dry, needs more cheese and oil in the pan for the tortilla shells. I had to smother it in guac and sour cream to get it down. 2 others at the table said the same thing about theres. Chips and guac was excellent, but I suggest the servers should know the price of the sides of guac if they're not going to put it on the menu, I still never found out.

The hostess was very arrogant when we asked for a table. She said it would take ten minutes to seat the two parties ahead of us. This was a pathetic timetable since more than 20 clean tables were open.

Not the World's Best Chili's. The food is on par with any other Chilis you've gone to but the service just isn't what it could be.  Multiple visits have yielded similar results and a lunch here takes far longer than it should. 90 minutes is too long for semi-fast food and when you find yourself watching the kitchen for your food to come out, you know you've passed the line.   Good food if you have the time.

The service was great, the facility was clean, however the building was so freezing, it was borderline inappropriate. My entire party had goosebumps the entire time, no exaggeration. Our party had to send someone home to grab jackets and we were still freezing through them. The server did her best to apologize for how cold it was,  but the entire meal was completely unenjoyable due to the freezing temp. I cannot believe that a chain restaurant could possibly allow their temp to be so low (waitress said it was placed at 63 degrees.) this was the most uncomfortable meal I have ever sat through.

This location has gotten better at their service, a vast improvement in my opinion over what it was a year ago. In addition, the updated menu has some great new options - I love the new burgers and the prime rib rice bowl (so flavorful). But the primary thing that keeps me coming back is how friendly the staff is to my toddler, always going out their way to make her experience great, and that means everything to me!   Chili's isn't fancy, but neither are they trying to be, and colored to other similar restaurants in the area, including Iggy's and Applebee's, this location is the best option!

Took my family for dinner on Thursday evening. Our food tasted old like it had been sitting on a warmer for a long time. The service was awful they made us feel like we were inconveniencing them. My supposed supreme Margarita tasted like all they did was poor me a giant glass of sour mix. All in all we were very disappointed in this location.
Up at 5am with food poisoning from this place, good ol smoked poisoned chicken burrito . My friends really like it here but my experience has never been a good one.
Favorite chilis location. No more to be said about this delicacy of a restaurant. Order the guac.

This location is pretty hit and miss. The bar side is usually really quick and our order is accurate. The dining side is consistently bad. We ate there today and it was the worst experience yet. We were the server's only table and he completely forgot to ring in 2/3 of the order. My husband waited about 45 minutes for a cheeseburger. The manager brought it out and just said "Sorry- it shouldn't have taken that long" and walked away. They took $5 off our bill. Pretty unimpressed overall.

Good food, good service.  I got the dry rub ribs with fries. It wasn't out of this world, but it fed me and I was satisfied. The new "home" BBQ sauce was something else. I didn't love it and I didn't hate it. I couldn't put my finger on it. It was borderline synthetic tasting, but then I tried it again and it was just a sauce I hadn't tasted before. It flip flopped for me, so I just stopped dipping my rib meat in it. The dry rub on top was fantastic. My husband got chicken and shrimp fajitas. He really liked them. I had a taste and liked it a lot. They had a nice, light, summer-like flavor. The chicken was moist and the shrimp was cooked nicely. It wasn't shriveled up and rubbery like some I've had in my journey to find the perfect fajitas.  We've been to Chili's  (this location and others) over the years and never drop dead, loved our experience or food. Today however had a little spark and got us on the line. We'll come back and try something else to see if we can add this place to our weekend possibilities of  dining out. *No spoons, no napkins, didn't get the ranch we ordered, took a while for food, restaurant was empty....but then again it was only 4PM.

I've eaten at better chili's for sure. There was something that was just a little off with the service, the food, and the restaurant as a whole. I got a quesadilla that I didn't even finish.. which is unlike me because I love quesadillas. This might have just been an off night but I'll probably go to another chili's next time.

Terrible service, no manger in sight. Ignorance at its best!!! I have eaten here before and based on the food I would give it a 2 star rating. Last night I walked in and asked if I could sit at the bar and if I would need my I.D. The hostess said "I don't know." As we awkwardly waited for her to say "let me go find out." She just looked around.  Needless to say we took a seat in the bar area.  10 minutes pasted and during that time 8 serves walked by not offering any word of service. After 10 minutes I pushed off the wet rag that was at our table due to another server not cleaning up their area, onto the ground and walked out.  This is the poorest ran facility I've ever had the displeasure of eating at. Thank you chilis for this terrible evening.

Wow!  What a wonderful place. Service is so good (drinks quickly refilled; chips and salsa was delicious). Server asked if we wanted more chips, but said no to save room for our main meals (margarita flat bread, alfredo chicken pasta, and grilled chicken breast with mango salsa). When the check came, our server brought a large bag of fresh chips with more salsa. Amazing. Thank you.

The food was great and our server, Daniel, was so helpful and attentive. We will go back more and more. The food was delicious and hot. The restaurant was clean and service was fast. We had a wonderful lunch today at Chili's and it was great. Tried something and the loaded potato soup was so good. We all loved what we had and our server Daniel, was the greatest. Didn't need to ask for refills of drinks and our friend loved his lunch too and commented what a good server Daniel was.

Hair.  Full-on strand of hair on top of my steak!  I'm not freaked out, and I calmly told the server about the problem.  He offered to have the kitchen cook up a new one, but my apatite was pretty well gone, so I just asked him to take it off the bill (which he did).  Then...It gets REAL weird.  The server takes my plate with the "hair-steak" and I can see him showing another worker (manager perhaps?) and this guy clearly rolls his eyes and says something to him.  Then he comes back to the table, unceremoniously drops of the bill at the table, and walks away like he can't wait to get rid of us.  I'm like..."excuse me, we still want to buy a dessert please" Lol!  We get the molten cake, and leave.   There's only two reasons I can think of that they would treat us this way; First, this "hair-in-the-food" problem happens ALL the time here, and the server immediately chalked us up as an unlikely tip, so why try?  OR, They think I planted a hair on my steak to get something for free!  Seriously, that is how they made me feel!  like I was trying to pull prank on them.   So "Thanks a lot" for adding insult to injury today Chili's!  I don't care how much we like your damn molten cake.  We'll find another place to spend 50 bucks next time.

The table was sticky and dirty. The portable table credit card scanner was filthy.  We have been to Chili's many times, but not at this location.  My Caribbean  salad was good as usual. My husbands Mex-egg rolls were not good. His slider was good enough but was very plain. Onion rings ok- for the price we expected larger portions. The strawberry-aid was terrible, although the raspberry lemon aid was good.
It has been a while since I've been to Chili's. The menu selection has shrunk. Our server, Monica, was great. The food was good as well as the portion size.

If you ever decide to eat at this location do yourself and request Jake as your server! I have never had such incredible service. Everything was perfect, and FAST! He had great suggestions for us and paid the perfect amount of attention to the table. Awesome meal, incredible service. We'll definitely be back!
